With the right maintenance methods, our designs are designed to be with you for life, even to be inherited.

HOW TO MAINTENANCE:

- Take it off when exercising, before swimming, bathing and sleeping.

- Limit exposure of your jewelry to extreme temperatures, perfumes and cosmetics.

- Avoid contact with harsh chemicals or household cleaning products.

- Store flat in a safe and dry environment.

- If you have any open rings or diamond earrings, do not pinch or twist to resize them. This can lead to stones falling out in the future.

- Clean carefully using warm water, a drop of dish soap and a soft brush. Rinse with cold water after a few minutes. Do not immerse opals, bright blue moonstones or rubies.

Your gold pieces also need special care. Because gold is a soft and relatively delicate metal, be careful when cleaning and storing your gold jewelry. To clean your gold jewelry, use a mixture of some warm water and a few drops of mild soap. Gently brush your jewelry in this mixture, then rinse and dry with a soft cloth. When storing your gold jewellery, store it in a place where it does not rub against each other or scratch, in their own case if possible or in a jewelery box. Try to keep your gold jewelry away from perfumes, cosmetics and chemicals.
